items.source: 2. Project Progress for the Final Period

items.preLabel:
2.1 Provide a short summary of what was achieved in the final period against the Activity outlined in your Funding Agreement
Where possible, please quantify key outputs or achievements. Supporting evidence of your activities and achievements (e.g. media releases, articles, photos, etc.), should be provided as attachments to this report via the Admin tab > Documents sub-tab of MERIT.

items.source: 2.2 Did the project encounter any issues or delays in delivering actions in the final period? If yes, please outline in the table below.

columns.title: How did you manage the issue?
Implications for the project
columns.helpText: (e.g. Impacts on timeframes, feasibility, costs, ability to meet contracted deliverables)

items.preLabel: 2.3 Have you had any reportable WHS incidents this reporting period?

items.source: If 'Yes', please provide updated details by email direct to the Department.

items.preLabel: 2.4 Have any grants been provided to wildlife rehabilitation volunteers for equipment and consumables for long term care of orphaned and injured native wildlife during this reporting period?
Please provide details of the grants

items.source:
Please provide good news stories that highlight what the project achieved in the final period.
This information is intended for potential use by the Department in publicly promoting the program. Photos may be attached to this report via attachment to email however please ensure permissions of persons in the photos are obtained prior to the photos being attached and used for promotional purposes.

items.preLabel: 4.1 Provide a summary of what project monitoring and/or evaluation activities have been undertaken this period.
4.2 Provide a summary of any key findings and/or learnings gained this period from the project.
4.3 Provide a summary of any changes you have made in response to these during the reporting period.
5.1 Has the project funding been expended in accordance with the Activity Budget, and have funds been fully expensed?
5.2 If you have answered no, please provide details:

items.source: 6. Reporting by activity for the final period

6.1 Report progress of activities undertaken during the final reporting period using relevant activity fields below. Where activity outputs have not been reported in MERIT previously, please combine progress in this report. Please ensure all mapping is completed for the project in the Sites tab of MERIT.

Note: Please de-select ‘Not applicable’ for activities that were undertaken during the final reporting period and complete the required fields. For more information, please contact your Departmental Project Manager

columns.name: targetMeasure
columns.description: The output target measure to be adjusted.

items.preLabel:
7.1 Provide a summary of what was achieved during the project, including but not limited to:
a) environmental outcomes
b) impact and legacy of the project on the assets targeted
c) any social outcomes, such as engagement with Indigenous Owners, landholders and local community

items.source:
7.2 Describe achievements made by the project against each relevant intended outcome of the Wildlife Rescue and Rehabilitation program, including measurable information where available.

Supporting evidence to demonstrate achievement against intended outcomes (e.g. report, monitoring data sets, photos, media articles, etc) should be provided as attachments to this report via the Admin tab > Documents sub-tab of MERIT. Supporting evidence should be labelled to reference the applicable outcome. Where supporting evidence contains sensitive or confidential information, please send to your Grant Manager by email.

columns.title: Intended Outcome as per Grant Agreement

items.preLabel: 8.1 Did project implementation occur as planned? Describe the effectiveness of the project delivery and monitoring methodology and whether alternative methods might be more effective / efficient.
8.2 Summarise the overall lessons learned during the project.
9.1 Describe how co-contributions were used to achieve the project outcomes, if applicable.
9.2 Summarise the role of project partners in achieving project outcomes, if applicable.
